intro: Haplopappus anethifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves that are aromatic and often used in traditional herbal medicine. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, typically growing in open, rocky soils. Haplopappus anethifolius is known for its small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months.
